Issues.Title: Update sass 1.66.1 ‚Üí 1.67.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sass (1.66.1 ‚Üí 1.67.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.67.0

To install Sass 1.67.0, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • All functions defined in CSS Values and Units 4 are now once again parsed as calculation objects: round(), mod(), rem(), sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), atan2(), pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), exp(), abs(), and sign().

    Unlike in 1.65.0, function calls are not locked into being parsed as calculations or plain Sass functions at parse-time. This means that user-defined functions will take precedence over CSS calculations of the same name. Although the function names calc() and clamp() are still forbidden, users may continue to freely define functions whose names overlap with other CSS calculations (including abs(), min(), max(), and round() whose names overlap with global Sass functions).

  • As a consequence of the change in calculation parsing described above, calculation functions containing interpolation are now parsed more strictly than before. However, all interpolations that would have produced valid CSS will continue to work, so this is not considered a breaking change.

  • Interpolations in calculation functions that aren't used in a position that could also have a normal calculation value are now deprecated. For example, calc(1px #{"+ 2px"}) is deprecated, but calc(1px + #{"2px"}) is still allowed. This deprecation is named calc-interp. See the Sass website for more information.

  • Potentially breaking bug fix: The importer used to load a given file is no longer used to load absolute URLs that appear in that file. This was unintented behavior that contradicted the Sass specification. Absolute URLs will now correctly be loaded only from the global importer list. This applies to the modern JS API, the Dart API, and the embedded protocol.

Embedded Sass

  • Substantially improve the embedded compiler's performance when compiling many files or files that require many importer or function call round-trips with the embedded host.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 7 commits:

  • Re-enable new calculation functions (#2080)
  • Fix example (#2074)
  • Run cli compilations in parallel dart isolates (#2078)
  • Don't try to load absolute URLs from the base importer (#2077)
  • Improve `sass --embedded` performance (#2013)
  • Stop working around dart-lang/linter#4381 (#2071)
  • Update README.md (#2069)
#### ‚ú≥Ô∏è jiti (1.19.3 ‚Üí 1.20.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/unjs/jiti) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/unjs/jiti/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.20.0

compare changes

üöÄ Enhancements

  • Experimental native Bun support (#156)

üíÖ Refactors

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

  • chore(deps): update devdependency execa to v8 (#160)

Issues.Title: Make `dark:` variant fully customizable.

Issues.Title: Background opacity modifier does not work with CSS variable's fallback value
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** version: 3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** play.tailwindcss.com **What version of Node.js are you using?** browser **What browser are you using?** chrome **What operating system are you using?** macOs **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/djB8sJngwG **Describe your issue** Full example code: ```html
1. classic
2. custom color
3. custom color from var
4. custom color from var with fallback
5. custom color from var with opacity
6. custom color from var with fallback and with opacity
7. custom color from var with fallback and with "manual" opacity
``` It seems tailwind is unable to properly process such syntax: `bg-[rgb(var(--broken-var,var(--color-red)))]/50`. There's no output at all. The reason for this is most likely CSS variable being nested for fallback value. For nested `var()` without opacity modifier: `bg-[rgb(var(--broken-var,var(--color-red)))]` the output is correct: ```css .bg-\[rgb\(var\(--broken-var\2c var\(--color-red\)\)\)\]{ background-color: rgb(var(--broken-var,var(--color-red))) } ``` The only reasonable workaround I found is to "manually" apply alpha value to `rgb()` function like so: `bg-[rgb(var(--broken-var,var(--color-red))/0.5)]`, which gives an output that I would expect to get for the broken example: ```css .bg-\[rgb\(var\(--broken-var\2c var\(--color-red\)\)\/0\.5\)\]{ background-color: rgb(var(--broken-var,var(--color-red))/0.5) } ``` However, I think it would be great to be able to use consistent syntax across all use-cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Background opacity modifier does not work with CSS variable's fallback value" (#12048)

Issues.Title: Handle variable colors that have variable fallback values
Issues.Body:
We couldn't parse variables in arbitrary values which had a fallback that was itself a variable and as a result would produce nothing when such a color was used in `bg-*` or `text-*` or any other color utility.

Basically this didn't work because the presence of the alpha value forces us to parse the color format:
```
bg-[rgb(var(--some-var,var(--some-other-var)))]/50
```

This PR fixes it and it now produces the following CSS:
```css
.bg-\[rgb\(var\(--some-var\,var\(--some-other-var\)\)\)\]\/50 {
  background-color: rgb(var(--some-var, var(--some-other-var)) / 0.5);
}
```


This implementation is limited because regexes are not recursive. For example, it can't handle _another_ variable fallback like this:
```
bg-[rgb(var(--some-var,var(--some-other-var,var(--some-other-var-3))))]/50
```

Doing so would require replacing these regexes with an actual mini tokenizer and parser but that's a task for another day.

Fixes #12048
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Handle variable colors that have variable fallback values" (#12049)

Issues.Title: translate-x-[value in px] not working in Next JS 13 when using tailwind
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

NextJS 13.4.19, React v18.2.0 

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.17.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

**Describe your issue**
i tried to use the translate-x-[] syntax by passing in a custom value like 148px to the class and its not working.
exact syntax is transform -translate-x-[148px]

Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "translate-x-[value in px] not working in Next JS 13 when using tailwind" (#12044)

Issues.Title: Add `@starting-style` variant
Issues.Body:
This PR adds support for `@starting-style` through the `starting:` variant.

`@starting-style` was [shipped in Chrome 117](https://chromestatus.com/feature/4515377717968896)

Further Reading:
- https://www.bram.us/2023/05/24/the-yellow-fade-technique-with-modern-css-using-starting-style/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `@starting-style` variant" (#12040)

Issues.Title: Add support for `text-wrap: pretty`
Issues.Body:
This PR adds support for `text-wrap: pretty` through the `text-pretty` utility.

`text-wrap: pretty` was [shipped in Chrome 117](https://chromestatus.com/feature/5145771917180928).

Unlike `text-wrap: balance`, where all lines are made to have equal-length, `text-wrap: pretty` prevents the final line from being excessively short. It serves as a value specifically designed to prevent widows without requiring additional formatting.

Further Reading:

- https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#valdef-text-wrap-style-pretty
- https://clagnut.com/blog/2424/

ref https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/11320
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add support for `text-wrap: pretty`" (#12031)

Issues.Title: Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open error with version 3.3.3
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss: 0.11.0, postcss-cli: 10.1.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18.4.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Edge, FireFox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

Sorry unable to provide the reproduction url since our project is private. The error is not happening with tailwind version 3.3.2

**Describe your issue**

We have upgraded our project to tailwind 3.3.3 and we started getting this error

[Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open 
  errno: -4066,
  code: 'EMFILE',
  syscall: 'open',

The error is not happening with version 3.3.2

Thanks in advance for the help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open error with version 3.3.3" (#12003)

Features

Refactor

  • (common) Make ahash optional (#7816) (981d7b1)

1.3.77 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

Features

Issues.Title: Update @swc/core 1.3.76 ‚Üí 1.3.84 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãswc/core (1.3.76 ‚Üí 1.3.84) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/swc-project/swc) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/swc-project/swc/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.3.84 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Emit leading comments for ExprStmt (#7916) (2da5895)

  • (es/codegen) Use emitAssertForImportAttributes (#7936) (dac8888)

  • (es/compat) Visit assign expr in generator (#7932) (97068e1)

1.3.83 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (css/modules) Aggregate class names when composes is chained. (#7917) (0db25a2)

  • (es/module) Revert #7901 (#7906) (85d6e9b)

  • (es/module) Fix jsc.paths for projects using pnpm (#7918) (a86e9f3)

Features

  • (es/codegen) Add an option to print assert for import attributes (#7914) (ee75756)

1.3.82 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (common) Fix logic for excluding FileName from source maps (#7900) (aa64955)

  • (es/module) Make jsc.paths fully resolve TypeScript files (#7901) (c714dd2)

  • (es/resolver) Correctly resolve global value (#7893) (2db10e9)

1.3.81 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Fix placing of comments of yield arguments (#7858) (122d14c)

  • (es/compat) Apply transforms for explicit resource management (#7881) (3180e68)

  • (es/compat) Make SwitchCase handler of block-scoping stateless (#7888) (4b33d41)

  • (es/dep-graph) Analyze import type children (#7883) (057bd5f)

  • (es/minifier) Report is_fn_local even if var is hoisted (#7876) (87a47bf)

  • (es/module) Don't create absolute paths for jsc.paths on Windows (#7892) (5fbc251)

  • (swc-info) Use correct path while getting local package versions (#7872) (67afaf1)

Features

  • (es) Add an option to disable builtin transforms (#7873) (71d01ec)

  • (es/ast) Support import attributes proposal (#7868) (4d3fcb8)

  • (es/preset-env) Update data (#7882) (a97d8b4)

  • (swc-info) Add a CLI to help issue reporting (#7871) (d6952ea)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • (deps) Update memchr (#7891) (01cbd6e)- general: Use textarea for swc-info (eed2903)

Performance

  • (es/transforms) Remove wrong parallelism (#7889) (a505012)

Refactor

  • (es/minifier) Remove mutated and mutation_by_call_count (#7890) (8db968a)

1.3.80 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/module) Fix logic for exact matches in jsc.paths (#7860) (52a1ee7)

  • (es/module) Don't resolve as node_modules from TscResolver (#7866) (11ebae1)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • general: Remove unused files (e47f1c2)

1.3.79 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es) Fix default value of jsc.minify.format.comments (#7853) (64e51d3)

  • (es/minifier) Don't inline properties if the var is not fn-local (#7839) (7fe01e6)

  • (es/minifier) Don't remove exports (#7856) (ae8cd94)

  • (es/module) Make jsc.paths work for a nest.js app (#7852) (d33a973)

Features

  • (css/ast) Support @scope at-rule (#7837) (a34f359)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • (ci) Fix CI (#7857) (854e2e7)

Refactor

  • (common) Mark some methods of Input unsafe (#7848) (c657324)

  • (es/helpers) Move packages for monorepo (#7833) (1ab406c)

  • (es/minifier) Pre-calculate reassigned (#7832) (65db1ba)

  • (es/types) Extract @swc/types as a small, reusable package (#7834) (f713f1b)

1.3.78 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Add quotes to property names when ascii_only is true (#7820) (04921f3)

  • (es/compat) Remove wrong logic for object patterns in object_rest (#7788) (3766a7c)

  • (es/minifier) Preserve cooked while compressing template literals (#7773) (05990a9)

  • (es/minifier) Abort seq inliner if var is not fn_local or reassigned (#7804) (f8ca366)

  • (es/minifier) Preserve more analysis data upon inlining (#7823) (31de19e)

Features

  • (es/module) Improve error message about relative jsc.baseUrl (#7827) (9099883)

Refactor

  • (common) Make ahash optional (#7816) (981d7b1)

  • (es/parser) Remove needless unsafe (#7818) (8b809db)- general: Use ahash from swc_common in more places (#7815) (b43e38d)

1.3.77 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es) Resolve jsc.baseUrl for .swcrc specified by --config-file (#7801) (fe1ca26)

  • (es/compat) Revert #7610 (#7813) (42dec55)

  • (es/parser) Revert lexer fix for << (#7807) (e527c12)

Features

  • (es/ast) Expose Archived types (#7811) (478fa47)

Refactor

  • (es/parser) Don't attempt to handle shebangs in read_token_number_sign (#7803) (5e7834a)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

Issues.Title: Tracking classes issue
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Astro


**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Describe your issue**

tracking-tighter
tracking-tight
classes should be positive (+) and are negative (-)

same with 
-tracking-tighter
-tracking-tight
classes should be negative (-) and are positive (+)

--and having -tracking-normal (-0em) is redundant to tracking-normal (0em)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tracking classes issue" (#11989)

Issues.Title: Can't set a border-width by CSS var like border-[--my-css-var]
Issues.Body:
This will result in the `border-color` being set.

tailwindcss v3.3.1
vite/4.1.1 darwin-arm64 node-v20.3.1
Node.js v20.3.1

https://play.tailwindcss.com/h24E9Hgscb
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't set a border-width by CSS var like border-[--my-css-var]" (#11987)

Issues.Title: Preflight: "Cursor" not Added
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.3.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v18.8.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
Windows 11

**Describe your issue**
Hello, I'm here to report an issue. on Preflight "Cursor" property didn't get reset. like if I hover on "a" tag, the cursor will turn into the pointer.
as Tailwind Preflight should reset lot of things this one is one of them too. tysm
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Preflight: "Cursor" not Added" (#11985)

Issues.Title: No Autocomplete
Issues.Body:
**What version of VS Code are you using?**

v1.81.1

**What version of Tailwind CSS IntelliSense are you using?**

v0.10.0

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What package manager are you using?**

npm

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Tailwind config**

```ts
import type { Config } from 'tailwindcss'

const config: Config = {
  content: [
    './src/pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
    './src/components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
    './src/app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      backgroundImage: {
        'gradient-radial': 'radial-gradient(var(--tw-gradient-stops))',
        'gradient-conic':
          'conic-gradient(from 180deg at 50% 50%, var(--tw-gradient-stops))',
      },
    },
  },
  plugins: [],
}
export default config
```

**VS Code settings**

```json
{
    "translation.baidu.appId": "########",
    "translation.baidu.appKey": "########",
    "editor.detectIndentation": false,
    "explorer.sortOrder": "type",
    "editor.tabSize": 2,
    "javascript.updateImportsOnFileMove.enabled": "always",
    "workbench.editorAssociations": {
      "*.docx": "default"
    },
    "git.suggestSmartCommit": false,
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay"
}
```

**Reproduction URL**

[github](https://github.com/fengluo2/test1)

**Describe your issue**

No Autocomplete.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No Autocomplete" (#11976)

Issues.Title: Can someone tell me what is causing this animation to behave like this on iOS and iPadOS.
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v 3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
Next.js 13.4.19

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v 19.7.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome, Safari

**What operating system are you using?**
Windows, iOS, iPadOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/confident-brown-4p8y7l

https://4p8y7l-5173.csb.app/

**Describe your issue**
There is some weird glitch or something that is happening when I click on the toggle button "loading: true". The loading bug occurs only on iPad, iOS, (not tested on MacOS). It works fine on Windows and Android browsers. I teseted on Chrome and Safari on iOS and iPadOS and Chrome on Windows and Android.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can someone tell me what is causing this animation to behave like this on iOS and iPadOS." (#11959)

Issues.Title: Remove matrix.setup from release-insiders.yml
Issues.Body: `setup` was never part of the matrix.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove matrix.setup from release-insiders.yml" (#11954)

Issues.Title: Stop converting issues to discussions. Issues are issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Stop converting issues to discussions. Issues are issues. " (#11955)

Issues.Title: ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

sveltekit

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.3.0

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox, Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/PwsDG36K97

**Describe your issue**

I don't know if this intended or is a bug;
but when using `ring` with `ring-opacity` on a dark color scheme,
the dark variant ignores the `ring-opacity`, but works if `dark:ring-opacity` is present
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme" (#11950)

Issues.Title: Split background color While I only have one color
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** postcss-cli 8.4.28 Next.js 13.4.19, webpack 5.88.2 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v20.3.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome, edge, Arc **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. [See here](https://play.tailwindcss.com/mPWKwBxGTB?file=config) **Describe your issue** As you can see the background is split in two color while the body has only custom one named bg-dark-50. If you put a border 1px solid everywhere, or add opacity bg-dark-50/90 or even disable margin-0 on layout.css it fixes the problem. You can even just change the color. But unfortunately that's my background color ^^ I tried with different dark colors some work other don't. For example #1A1A1A has no problem. Hope it helps. Sure it could help me. Thank you for your time. :) Edit: You need a screen that can display Rec 709 or almost adobe RGB 1998. For example Apple RGB or lowest are not wide enough to display full colors
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Split background color While I only have one color" (#11946)

Issues.Title: `matchUtilities` can't handle nested values
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`matchUtilities` can't handle nested values" (#11942)

Issues.Title: Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities
Issues.Body: Adds utilities for [`forced-colors-adjust`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/forced-color-adjust)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities" (#11931)

Issues.Title: Add scripting variants
Issues.Body: This adds two variants for the [`scripting`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/scripting) media query. `noscript` for when JavaScript is disabled and `scripting` for when it's enabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add scripting variants" (#11929)
